question.title: How to register a CustomConstraintValidator?
question.body:
I have a problem. Hibernate constraints have been created in a library developed by us and made known with the resources/META-INF/validation.xml. These validations work wonderfully. They are also entered in the entities via annotation. If I now create another constraint in my project and create a validation.xml, the one from the library is ignored. If I delete the validation.xml in my project again, the constraints from the library are executed, but not those from the project. Now I have searched for a solution and found these pages:

  • How to register custom ConstraintMapping for validations defined in validation-constraints.xml
  • HibernateValidator constraintMapping for the fields inside nested object structure
  • https://medium.com/@cat.edelveis/creating-spring-boot-custom-validators-17790c33447e

Unfortunately, they do not solve my problem. When I create a validator bean, the constrains are only executed with xyzValidator.validate(...), but not with the repo.save() method, or with @Valid parameter ... in the REST service. What am I doing wrong? How can I register a custom constraint that is checked by Hibernate like all other constraints without being able to enter an annotation in the entity and without a validation.xml?
